intro: Daknopholis boivinii, commonly known as the Boivin's spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive lobed shape, while the flowers are clustered in complex inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, Daknopholis boivinii is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
